question: Extensor carpi radialis longus is a/an -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Wrist extensoro Extensor carpi radialis longus causes:-i) Extension of wristii) Abduction of wristo It is supplied by radial nerve.

question: Strongest supinator muscle is -
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Biceps "The biceps brachii is the strongest supinator of the forearm because of its distal attachment on the radial tuberosity "Movement. Muscles causing movement. Pronation. Pronator quadratus (strong pronator). Pronator teres (Rapid pronator). Supination. Supinator (when elbow is extended), Biceps (when elbow is flexed).

question: Supination in flexed elbow is produced by -
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Biceps Movement. Muscles causing movement. Pronation. Pronator quadratus (strong pronator), Pronator teres (Rapid pronator). Supination. Supinator (when elbow is extended). Biceps (when elbow is flexed).
